title: Edinburgh weather: Princes Street Gardens closed to public due to 'high winds'

Show Me No thanks, close See our Privacy Notice Edinburgh's Princes Street Gardens will be closed today due to the weather .
Edinburgh Council informed locals that the gardens will be closed on Friday, March 22 due to 'high winds'.
While there is no weather warning, the Met Office is forecasting a blustery day.
READ NEXT- Edinburgh man, 38, arrested in connection with death after city bus stop attack
READ NEXT- Viral Edinburgh cookie shop forced to close doors to venue as 'ceiling collapses'
According to weather forecasters, winds are expected to reach 44 miles per hour on Friday by 3pm and it will remain in the 30 range for the rest of the evening.
While temperatures are expected to reach up to 7C, the Met Office forecasts that it will feel as cold as 0C with a chilly wind in the air.
The Met Office forecasts a cold and windy day across Edinburgh, the Borders and Dumfries and Galloway. On its website, it reads: " Cold and windy today with sunny spells and blustery showers. Some of the showers may be heavy at times with a risk of hail and thunder. The eastern Borders will have the best of the drier and sunniest conditions. Maximum temperature 8C.
Taking to social media, Edinburgh Council wrote: "Due to forecasted high winds tomorrow (Friday March 22) Princes Street Gardens will be closed. Keep up to date with the weather on the @metofficeUK website."
